meanings.definition: The act or process of changing in form or nature.
meanings.sent1: The transmutations of the caterpillar into a butterfly are truly remarkable.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the transmutations of elements in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent3: The transmutations of the characters in the story kept the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: Her art reflects the transmutations of emotions through vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The transmutations of the landscape after the storm were breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A change in form, nature, or substance.
meanings.sent1: The transmutations of the clay into a beautiful vase amazed the pottery class.
meanings.sent2: The transmutations of the tadpole into a frog are fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent3: The transmutations of the weather from sunny to rainy caught us off guard.
meanings.sent4: The transmutations of the music from classical to jazz added a new dimension.
meanings.sent5: The transmutations of the building into a modern art gallery revitalized the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The result of a transformation or change.
meanings.sent1: The transmutations of hard work and dedication led to her success.
meanings.sent2: The transmutations of the recipe with added spices made it more flavorful.
meanings.sent3: The transmutations of the room with new furniture gave it a fresh look.
meanings.sent4: The transmutations of the garden after planting new flowers were stunning.
meanings.sent5: The transmutations of the city skyline with new skyscrapers were impressive.
